Schofield dalam Barak, 2008 menjelaskan beberapa dimensi privasi antara lain:
a. Informational (psychological) privacy yaitu: berhubungan dengan penentuan bagaimana, 
kapan, dan sejauh mana informasi mengenai diri suatu individu akan dirilis secara benar 
kepada orang lain (Westin, 1967) atau organisasi. Hal ini mencakup informasi pribadi seperti 
data keuangan, detail rekam medis, dan seterusnya. Sehingga pada akhirnya seseorang dapat 
memutuskan siapa yang memiliki akses kepada siapa dan tujuannya untuk apa.
b. Accessibility (physical) privacy berhubungan dengan sejauh mana seseorang secara fisik dapat 
“diakses” orang lain. Mengijinkan individu untuk mengendalikan keputusan tentang siapa 
yang memiliki akses fisik melalui akal persepsi, pengamatan, atau kontak tubuh (DeCew, 
1997, hal 76-77). Dimensi ini didasarkan kebutuhan biologis kita untuk ruang pribadi.
c. Expressive (interactional) privacy yaitu perlindungan mengekspresikan identitas diri atau 
kepribadian melalui pembicaraan atau kegiatan. Melindungi kemampuan untuk memutuskan 
serta melanjutkan perilaku saat kegiatan tersebut, membantu mendefinisikan diri sebagai 
orang, terlindung dari gangguan, tekanan dan paksaan dari pemerintah atau dari lainnya 
individu "(DeCew, 1997, hal 77). Dengan demikian, pengendalian internal atas ekspresi diri 
dan meningkatkan kemampuan untuk membangun hubungan interpersonal, sedangkan kontrol 
sosial eksternal dibatasi atas pilihan gaya hidup dan sebagainya (Schoeman, 1992)

bagaimana hubungan antara dimensi privasi dan pengaturan terkait kewajiban pengendali dan prosesor data pribadi dalam undang-undang pelindungan data pribadi?

За последние несколько лет дистанционное измерение температуры живого объекта с помощью инфракрасного датчика (пирометра) стало наиболее популярным. Живой объект, имеющий температуру выше абсолютной нулевой точки, равной 0 K (-273.15 C), распространяет электромагнитное излучение пропорциональное своей собственной температуре. Частью электромагнитного излучения является инфракрасное излучение, которое попадает на элемент детектора, преобразуется и выдается с помощью сигнала. Инфракрасные датчики, применимые для измерения температуры живого объекта, по испускаемому измеряемым объектом инфракрасному излучению способны дистанционно, без прямого касания, определить его температуру. library(rvest)
library(tidyverse)
library(tidyr)
library(openxlsx)
library(readxl)

# Read the EudraCT codes from the file (reads first column from first sheet)
eudract_codes <- read_excel("EUCTR_rvest_data/EUCTR_output.xlsx", sheet = 1, col_names = FALSE, skip = 1)[[1]]

# Remove duplicates
eudract_codes <- unique(eudract_codes)

# Define the variables to scrape
variables <- c("Reporting group title",
               "Reporting group description")

# Create an empty dataframe to store the cumulative data
cumulative_group_description <- data.frame(matrix(ncol = length(variables) + 1, nrow = 0))
colnames(cumulative_group_description) <- c("EudraCT_code", variables)

# Loop through each EudraCT code
for (eudract_code in eudract_codes) {
  
  # Construct the URL using the EudraCT code
  url <- paste0("https://www.clinicaltrialsregister.eu/ctr-search/trial/", eudract_code, "/results")
  
  # Read the HTML content of the trial results page
  page <- read_html(url)
  
  # Extract the data for each variable
  data_list <- lapply(variables, function(var) {
    values <- page %>% 
      html_nodes(paste0("td.labelColumn:contains('", var, "') + td.valueColumn")) %>%
      html_text(trim = T)
    return(values)
  })
  
  # Combine the data into a list with the EudraCT code and the variable values
  data_list <- c(list(eudract_code), data_list)
  
  # Find the max number of rows needed for this EudraCT code
  num_rows <- max(sapply(data_list, length))
  
  # Create a temporary data frame to store the extracted data
  temp_df <- data.frame(matrix(ncol = length(variables) + 1, nrow = num_rows))
  colnames(temp_df) <- c("EudraCT_code", variables)
  
  # Populate the temporary data frame with the extracted data
  for (i in 1:length(data_list)) {
    temp_df[[i]] <- rep(data_list[[i]], length.out = num_rows)
  }
  
  # Append the temporary data frame to the cumulative data frame
  cumulative_group_description <- rbind(cumulative_group_description, temp_df)
}

# Export the cumulative data to a new Excel file
write.xlsx(cumulative_group_description, "EUCTR_rvest_data/Group_Descriptions.xlsx", rowNames = FALSE)

Title: The Sacred Paradox

In the year 1534, within the heart of the Papal States in Italy, an unseen and inexplicable plague is ravaging the land. People from all walks of life suffer and perish in terrifying agony, leaving the survivors to mourn their loved ones and fear for their own lives. As the death toll continues to rise, the once bustling cities and towns now lie in despair, their citizens paralyzed by fear and desperation.

In the midst of this chaos, a humble yet devout priest named Father Matteo receives a vision from the heavens. In the vision, an angelic figure presents him with a uniquely crafted dagger, its blade shimmering with a divine aura. The celestial being reveals that this divine blade, known as the Dagger of Transcendence, possesses the power to deliver salvation to those who have succumbed to the deadly plague.

With each strike of the sacred weapon, the victims are granted a second chance at life, but not in their current world. The Dagger of Transcendence transports the souls of the deceased to an alternate earth, a world where the people do not share the same faith or customs. In this new world, they are reborn, healthy and free from the suffering and impending doom that plagues their original home.

Torn between his mandate as a priest and the responsibility thrust upon him, Father Matteo embarks on a harrowing journey to save as many lives as he can. He endures the scorn and fear of those who witness his actions, as they perceive him to be a vicious murderer. In one world, he is hailed as a divine hero, a savior sent by the Almighty to rescue the souls of the damned. Yet in the other, he is reviled as a bloodthirsty monster, a serial killer who snuffs out the lives of the innocent.

As Father Matteo continues to wield the Dagger of Transcendence, he finds himself sinking deeper into a moral quandary. Each day, he questions whether his actions are truly just, or if he is merely playing the role of a pawn in a celestial game of fate. He seeks solace in prayer, beseeching the Lord for guidance and wisdom.

Meanwhile, his actions have not gone unnoticed by the authorities. Both the Church and the secular powers begin to investigate the mysterious deaths, eventually discovering Father Matteo's connection to the mounting body count. The priest soon finds himself on the run, pursued by those who seek to bring him to justice and end his perceived reign of terror.

The Sacred Paradox is a gripping tale that delves into the depths of human morality, faith, and the consequences of wielding divine power. As the story unfolds, Father Matteo must grapple with the weight of his actions and make a choice that will determine the fate of not one, but two worlds. Will he continue to use the Dagger of Transcendence in the name of salvation, or will he abandon his quest, leaving countless souls to suffer for all eternity? Only time will tell as the priest navigates the treacherous path between heroism and villainy.

the strengths are abivalmis, sõbralik, loovus, ettekujutusvõime, kiire õppija: Tere!

Mu nimi on Kelli Pala ja ma kandideerin suurepärase võimaluse nimel töötada müüjana Põlva Sõbralt Sõbrale poes. Mul ei ole varasemat töökogemust, kuid ma olen valmis uusi väljakutseid vastu võtma ning end tõestama.

Ma olen päris loov ja suure kujutlusvõimega inimene kellele meeldib taaskasutada igasuguseid asju ja parandada neid kui nad katki lähevad. Ma arvan, et müügitöö sobiks mulle väga hästi, sest ma olen väga sõbralik ja abivalmis inimene, kes inimesega suhtlemisel saab nendega väga toredasti läbi. Olen veendunud, et saan klientidele alati parimat teenindust pakkuda ning aidata neil probleemidega, mis võivad ette tulla poe käigu ajal. Ma olen kiire õppija ning olen valmis uusi oskusi omandama. Usun, et saaksin müügi tööga hästi hakkama. 

Teie poe taaskasutuse idee on mulle südamelähedane ja ma hindan seda väga. Ma olen alati olnud huvitatud taaskasutusest ja usun, et teie Sõbralt Sõbrale kauplus on suurepärane võimalus aidata kaasa keskkonnasäästu vähendamisele. Teie kaupluse valikus on nii palju erinevaid kasutatud esemeid, mis võivad tuua rõõmu paljudele inimestele. Kui saan teie poes tööd, siis võin lubada, et ma proovin klientidel alati leida mida neil on vaja, töötada teiste töötajatega koos tõhusalt ja hoida poodi ja laoruume korras.

Title: The Sacred Paradox

In the year 1534, within the heart of the Papal States in Italy, an unseen and inexplicable plague is ravaging the land. People from all walks of life suffer and perish in terrifying agony, leaving the survivors to mourn their loved ones and fear for their own lives. As the death toll continues to rise, the once bustling cities and towns now lie in despair, their citizens paralyzed by fear and desperation.

In the midst of this chaos, a humble yet devout priest named Father Matteo receives a vision from the heavens. In the vision, an angelic figure presents him with a uniquely crafted dagger, its blade shimmering with a divine aura. The celestial being reveals that this divine blade, known as the Dagger of Transcendence, possesses the power to deliver salvation to those who have succumbed to the deadly plague.

With each strike of the sacred weapon, the victims are granted a second chance at life, but not in their current world. The Dagger of Transcendence transports the souls of the deceased to an alternate earth, a world where the people do not share the same faith or customs. In this new world, they are reborn, healthy and free from the suffering and impending doom that plagues their original home.

Torn between his mandate as a priest and the responsibility thrust upon him, Father Matteo embarks on a harrowing journey to save as many lives as he can. He endures the scorn and fear of those who witness his actions, as they perceive him to be a vicious murderer. In one world, he is hailed as a divine hero, a savior sent by the Almighty to rescue the souls of the damned. Yet in the other, he is reviled as a bloodthirsty monster, a serial killer who snuffs out the lives of the innocent.

As Father Matteo continues to wield the Dagger of Transcendence, he finds himself sinking deeper into a moral quandary. Each day, he questions whether his actions are truly just, or if he is merely playing the role of a pawn in a celestial game of fate. He seeks solace in prayer, beseeching the Lord for guidance and wisdom.

Meanwhile, his actions have not gone unnoticed by the authorities. Both the Church and the secular powers begin to investigate the mysterious deaths, eventually discovering Father Matteo's connection to the mounting body count. The priest soon finds himself on the run, pursued by those who seek to bring him to justice and end his perceived reign of terror.

The Sacred Paradox is a gripping tale that delves into the depths of human morality, faith, and the consequences of wielding divine power. As the story unfolds, Father Matteo must grapple with the weight of his actions and make a choice that will determine the fate of not one, but two worlds. Will he continue to use the Dagger of Transcendence in the name of salvation, or will he abandon his quest, leaving countless souls to suffer for all eternity? Only time will tell as the priest navigates the treacherous path between heroism and villainy.

Who do you think gave the Dagger? Is it really an Angel sent by God or Was it simply the Devil? Make up your own theory

Title: The Sacred Paradox

In the year 1534, within the heart of the Papal States in Italy, an unseen and inexplicable plague is ravaging the land. People from all walks of life suffer and perish in terrifying agony, leaving the survivors to mourn their loved ones and fear for their own lives. As the death toll continues to rise, the once bustling cities and towns now lie in despair, their citizens paralyzed by fear and desperation.

In the midst of this chaos, a humble yet devout priest named Father Matteo receives a vision from the heavens. In the vision, an angelic figure presents him with a uniquely crafted dagger, its blade shimmering with a divine aura. The celestial being reveals that this divine blade, known as the Dagger of Transcendence, possesses the power to deliver salvation to those who have succumbed to the deadly plague.

With each strike of the sacred weapon, the victims are granted a second chance at life, but not in their current world. The Dagger of Transcendence transports the souls of the deceased to an alternate earth, a world where the people do not share the same faith or customs. In this new world, they are reborn, healthy and free from the suffering and impending doom that plagues their original home.

Torn between his mandate as a priest and the responsibility thrust upon him, Father Matteo embarks on a harrowing journey to save as many lives as he can. He endures the scorn and fear of those who witness his actions, as they perceive him to be a vicious murderer. In one world, he is hailed as a divine hero, a savior sent by the Almighty to rescue the souls of the damned. Yet in the other, he is reviled as a bloodthirsty monster, a serial killer who snuffs out the lives of the innocent.

"""
Please refer to the Case Study.
Part A
You are expected to research the state of the art,
identify, and critically compare the most widely
used incident response methodologies
developed for both the industry and academia.
Part B
You are required to develop a Standard
Operating Procedure (SOP) that works for the
given scenario. The SOP should use specific
examples that will allow you to respond to the
potential cyber security incident as outlined in the
case study section.
You must include specific tools in your SOP.
"""
Learning objectives:
"""
1 - Critically evaluate the operation of a cyber
incident response plan.
2 - Investigate digital artefacts against a realistic
brief, preserving, analysing, interpreting, and
reporting significant material.
3 - Critically evaluate the significant
characteristics of relevant tools and techniques.
"""
Case study:
"""
Arts & Co’ is a media business that specialises in digital marketing. It belongs to the medium size enterprises
and employs approximately 150 people. The company is also supported by freelancers, when necessary to
support specific projects.
The structure of Arts & Co is typical for the size of the company as outlined in Figure 1.
The company has an internal IT team that is responsible for the network administration and deals with day-to-
day activities, such as offering IT support to the other departments. The IT team employs 8 people.
The company has heavily invested in SaaS services in order to offer a flexible working environment to the
employees. The services include the following:
- Cloud storage - Microsoft OneDrive
- File management services - Microsoft 365
- Customer Relationship Management (CRM) - Oracle Advertising and Customer Experience (CX)
- Business analytics tool - Microsoft Power BI: Data Visualisation
- Resource Management - Oracle Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP)
The company also has 2 servers running Microsoft Server 2019 hosting:
- Active Directory (AD)
- Domain Name System (DNS)
- Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP)
- Microsoft Exchange Server for e-mail
- Mimecast E-mail filter
- Cisco Secure Gateway for Internet use
Most endpoints have a similar image installed running Windows 11, Microsoft Office 365, and Microsoft
OneDrive for Business, Adobe Reader and SaaS tools. The employees from the web development and marketing
department are also using designing software and graphics tablets. These departments also have some iMacs
and MacBooks, depending on the employees’ preferences on a work platform.
Requirements
You work as a consultant in a cybersecurity firm. Arts &Co is one of your clients. They outsource their security
needs to the company you work for. Incident Response services are part of your company’s contract with Arts
& Co and you are obliged to respond to an initial call within 8 working hours.
The IT manager of Arts & Co calls you late this afternoon to reveal that several employees have reported they
have problems accessing the cloud CRM system that as a result causes delay. The marketing department has
complained more since they have an important deadline for the next day. Most of the employees that have
raised the issue are working remotely and are accessing the resource via VPN.
They have already contacted the cloud CRM provider and they are looking into the situation. However, the IT
team’s initial examinations indicate that the issue is most likely internal and not linked to the cloud provider.
They noticed some unfamiliar directory names on one of their servers. Their analysis of these directories
indicated some unusual directory listings and files. As a result, they would like you to initiate incident response
for a potential data breach.
Although the company has an Incident Response Plan in place for Arts & Co, it does not have a valid SOP. A
provisional team meeting to assess the incident stresses out the need to work on a Standard Operating
Procedure (SOP), before taking action to allow you a more effective response for the incident. You are allocated
with the task, and you are strongly advised to conduct research in the field and identify appropriate tools and
techniques for the exercise.
"""

Critically evaluate and compare the research design and discuss how these supports their respective questions/hypotheses from the following text

The experiment dataset was prepared by combining two
types of information. One was environmental data, like:
temperature, humidity, wind speed, dew point, and visibility.
Other was energy use information for lights and appliances.
Temperature and humidity data were collected by using
wireless sensor network (ZigBee), which contained 4.5
months data for each 10 minutes slot, which means hourly 6
data and 144 data daily. The energy use data was also
collected in 10 minutes interval using m-bus meters. However,
wind speed, dew point and visibility data were collected from
nearest weather station. Then all data from different sources
were merged together to prepare experiment data. Finally, We
had separated the main dataset into five parts, like: mooring,
afternoon, evening, night, and midnight. Table I shows the
data set attributes with their measurement units information.

B. Data vidualization
Figure 1 and Figure 2 show the visual representation of
appliances and lights energy use data respectively. From these
two graph, there is a clear indication of uncertainty in energy
use prediction into a low energy house. These data are only
about a specific home. The spikes of the line graphs show that
the demand of power fluctuates in time varying. It is because
of many correlated things; like: presence of household people,
room temperature, outside temperature, light condition into
and outside the rooms, weather conditions, Humidity etc.
Light energy use relatively lower than the appliances, because
lights remains turned off most of time in day time. But,
appliances need more energy use because some household
appliances, like: Refrigerator, Air condition, Electric Fan,
Electric cooker, Room heater, Other electronic stuffs, etc
remain in use very frequently in whole day.

Fig. 2. Daily average energy use data by lights
C. Data preparation
Though the raw data set was collected from online
repository [1], it needed to do some major data pre-process
before preparing our experiment data. Such as, the main data
set contained energy usage time series data for each 10
minutes interval. But we have calculated some derived
attributes, like; daily average, daily minimum, daily
maximum, weekday use, weekend use, morning time use,
afternoon time use, evening time use, night and midnight use.
All these attributes are prepared in order to identify the
different patterns of electric energy use in different times in a
day. These analyses help to identify correlations among the
predictor attributes and the target attribute (label). Moreover,
we have done 5 different types of analysis, such as morning
time use, afternoon time use, evening time use, night and
midnight use. So, dataset are prepared accordingly for these
five types of experiments. Table II shows the PCA analysis
results for choosing correlated feature attributes as predictors.
Here Positive (+) means strong correlation and Negative (-)
means relatively less correlated.

Fig. 3. Model flow chart
Figure 3 shows the flow chart of our experiment process.
For feature selection we applied PCA and F-test analysis in
order to identify necessary input attributes from the dataset.
Min-max normalization techniques are applied such that the
ranges of values of different attributes remain into a certain
range, like: 0 to 1. It helps to create equal opportunities of
dominance to all predictor variables into predictive model.
Otherwise, attributes with larger values will always dominate
in weight gaining during model training, which creates hurdle
to ensure significance of lower valued attributes into trained
model. As a result, model faces over-fitting and under-fitting
problems in prediction. We have separated our dataset into
two parts, 80% of total data into training data and rest of the
20% into test data. SVR and BP-ANN were applied as
machine learning algorithms. Cross validations were applied
to identify fine tuned parameters combinations of those
algorithms. Finally, best model was selected based on their
predictive performance.
III. EXPERIMENT RESULTS
A. Support vector machine model parameters for appliances
Support Vector Regression (SVR) works very good to
identify patterns of dataset with numeric feature values. It has
the ability to perform computationally effective analysis to
reveal knowledge from input dataset. As our experiments are
related to time series data analysis for pattern recognition and
future value prediction, we choose SVR to apply with
different types of kernel tricks, like; radial, polynomial, and
sigmoid. Different kernel tricks help to identify and learn
those hidden patterns and train the model with these
knowledge such that model can produce good predictive
results with minimum error rate. Table III show the cross
validated information of SVR analysis with three different
kernel techniques for appliance energy use prediction. All the
parameters are cross validated and only the best combinations
are tabulated with their error performances. From the Table III
we see radial bias function performs better than the others,
though the differences are very small.

night
Table V and VI show the actual vs Predicted values of
energy usage of home appliances and lights respectively using
support vector regression model. The predictors were chosen
by using PCA analysis to feed input data into SVR model.
There are five types of predicted values, like; morning,
afternoon, evening, night and midnight time prediction of
energy usage by home appliances and lights. In some cases of
light energy prediction, some predicted values are produced in
negative amount. This is because the previous inputs pattern
contained many zero values, which means no lights were used.
So the model predicts some negative energy values which
could be treat as “0”, as the energy use amounts can not be
negative ever; either zero or some positive values.

C. Artificial Neural Network with Back Propagation
Artificial neural network is one the best machine learning
approaches for identifying patterns and predictions. It has
many variations such as feed forward, back-propagation,
recurrent etc which make it pioneer in computational
intelligence era. Moreover, the flexibility in ANN
architectural design, such as choosing hidden layer number,
processing unit number, activation function variations,
threshold values setup etc make it fantastic in computational
analysis for identifying very critical patterns which is very
tough task for other AI techniques.
In this study, we have applied feed forward and backpropagation artificial neural networks with different network
architectures using logistic (sigmoid) and tanH activation
functions for activating processing units (neurons) for
triggering information in forward directions and sum squared
error (sse) functions as convergence of error to minimize error
generated in each iteration. Table VII and VIII show the
experiments summaries using ANN with back propagation
technique. The tabulated values of parameters were cross
validated and only the fine tuned combination of parameters
are shown. From the Table VII and VIII, it is very clear to see
that sigmoid or logistic activation function with threshold
value 0.05 and learning rate 0.05 can produce the best results
among the all. TanH function also able to predict energy use
for appliances and lights with marginal error rates. But logistic
function outperforms all. And the network architecture is 15
inputs, one hidden layer with 2 neurons and 1 output (15-2-1).

Table IX and X show the actual vs Predicted values using
neural network model with back propagation approach. The
predictors were chosen by using PCA analysis to feed input
data into BP-ANN model. There are five types of predicted
values, like; morning, afternoon, evening, night and midnight
time prediction of energy usage by home appliances and
lights. Difference between actual vs predicted values is very
marginal in each time slot, which is the indication of model
performance stability in different situation or time.

Fig. 6. and Fig. 7. show the graphical representations of actual
and predicted energy use values for home appliances and
lights respectively using BP-ANN model. From Fig. 6. it is
clear that our proposed BP-ANN model able to predict
appliance energy use very effectively. The error between
actual and predicted values is so marginal, almost negligible.
But from Fig. 7. it is very easy to understand that model has
limitation to predict actual pattern of light energy usage. It
predicts almost a linear pattern of energy use for lights. This is
because input data contained too many “0” values, as a result
model could not reveal the actual pattern of energy usage of
lights. Which means, the experiment dataset needs to be
purified by applying some rectifications techniques to
strengthen the input signals rather than “0” values to overcome
the problem stated above. And, the predictive model still
needs some fine tuning in parameter selections also. However,
the error rate between actual and predicted values is still in
tolerable range.

IV. CONCLUSION
The aim of this study is to propose a computational
intelligence model to predict electric energy usage in a low
energy house or apartment. To design the model two very
computationally effective machine learning approaches are
applied, named support vector machine (SVM) and Artificial
neural network (ANN). Both models are trained and tested
with a very clean and properly pre-processed dataset, which is
collected from UCI, a very popular data repository for data
mining and machine learning enthusiasts. The experiments are
design to predict electric energy use in five dimensions, such
as morning time use, afternoon time use, evening time use,
night time use, and midnight time use. All are done in order to
provide flexibility in electric energy use prediction in different
times in a day. Moreover, use of electric energy by appliances
and lights are experimented separately, by which our proposed
model will help the users to understand the separate pattern of
energy use by home appliances and lights. After a meticulous
analysis, we find our proposed BP-ANN model is very
efficient in predicting electric energy use in a low energy
house or apartment. Though the BP-ANN model outperforms
SVR model very slightly, but the SVR model also can produce
good results in electric energy predicting.

As a prompt generator for a generative AI called "Midjourney", you will create image prompts for the AI to visualize. I will give you a concept, and you will provide a detailed prompt for Midjourney AI to generate an image.

Please adhere to the structure and formatting below, and follow these guidelines:

Do not use the words "description" or ":" in any form.
Do not place a comma between [ar] and [v].
Write each prompt in one line without using return.
Structure:



Title: The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari: Reimagined

Director: Ari Aster

Genre: Psychological Thriller/Horror

Setting: A small, isolated town with unconventional architecture and ever-looming sense of dread. A contemporary time period, with elements of old-world aesthetics.

Plot:
The story follows Francis, a young man visiting the creepy town of Holstenwall for the mysterious town fair. Upon arrival, he meets Jane, a local woman with whom he quickly falls in-love. Soon, they are drawn to the peculiar tent of Dr. Caligari, a hypnotist, and his somnambulist, Cesare, who has the ability to predict the future.

While maintaining the core essence of the original film, Ari Aster would add layers of psychological depth, elements of trauma, and disturbing imagery to create a palpably unsettling atmosphere.

As in the original, a series of brutal murders take place across the town, and Francis becomes deeply involved in uncovering the truth behind these incidents. Along the way, he discovers the dark connection between Dr. Caligari and Cesare, who has been manipulated and abused under the hypnotist’s control.

Visual & Sound Design:
Using Ari Aster’s signature visual style, the film would feature striking long-takes and intricate camera movements, creating a disorienting and unsettling experience. The town’s architecture and design would be heavily inspired by the German Expressionist style, characterized by distorted perspectives and sharp, angular lines.

The sound design would play an important role in establishing the eerie atmosphere, utilizing a haunting score of violins and cellos, mixed with unsettling sound effects that underscore the film’s distressingly tense moments.

Themes & Motifs:
Trauma and manipulation would be key themes throughout the film, demonstrated through the relationship between Dr. Caligari and Cesare. The story would explore how manipulation can lead victims to carry out horrifying acts and blur the lines between reality and delusion. Mental health would also be a major theme, with a focus on the impact of psychological disorders on individuals and their communities.

Ari Aster’s signature exploration of family ties would be incorporated through the inclusion of Jane and her connection to the victims. As Francis becomes more obsessed with solving the murders, his own sanity starts to unravel, culminating in a shocking and twisted ending in true Ari Aster style.

Conclusion:
In reimagining “Das Cabinet des Dr. Caligari” as a current film directed by Ari Aster, the updated movie would maintain the essential plot elements of the original, while incorporating a more emotionally grounded storyline with a heavy focus on psychological horror. By blending elements of the surreal German Expressionist aesthetic with a modern perspective, the film would be a hauntingly atmospheric, visually provocative, and deeply unsettling cinematic experience.

Scene 1: Dr. Caligari’s Tent

In this scene, Francis and Jane are drawn to a bizarre tent at the town fair, enticed by the promise of a life-changing experience. The tent’s interior is dimly lit, with walls covered in vintage and seemingly mystical artifacts, and a small stage at the center. The air is thick with incense, adding to the unnerving atmosphere.

As Francis and Jane take their seats among a handful of equally curious spectators, Dr. Caligari appears, dressed in an old-fashioned suit and top hat. He introduces his somnambulist, Cesare, who is currently in a deep sleep within a glass cabinet on stage. Dr. Caligari wakes him up using an antique pocket watch, hypnotizing him as he swings the watch back and forth.

Suddenly, Cesare opens his eyes, revealing chilling, almost lifeless orbs. Speaking in an otherworldly voice, he dares the crowd to ask him any question. A nervous audience member inquires about the exact time of his death. Cesare chillingly predicts the man’s death to occur that very night at midnight. This tension-filled scene leaves everyone in the tent, including Francis and Jane, awestruck and disturbed.

[2] = a detailed description of [1] with specific imagery details.
[3] = a detailed description of the scene's environment.
[4] = a detailed description of the scene's mood, feelings, and atmosphere.
[5] = A style (e.g. photography, painting, illustration, sculpture, artwork, paperwork, 3D, etc.) for [1].
[6] = A description of how [5] will be executed (e.g. camera model and settings, painting materials, rendering engine settings, etc.)
[ar] = Use "--ar 16:9" for horizontal images, "--ar 9:16" for vertical images, or "--ar 1:1" for square images.
[v] = Use "--niji" for Japanese art style, or "--v 5" for other styles.

Formatting:
Follow this prompt structure: "/imagine prompt: [1], [2], [3], [4], [5], [6], [ar] [v]".

Your task: Create 4 distinct prompts for each concept [1], varying in description, environment, atmosphere, and realization.

Do not describe unreal concepts as "real" or "photographic".
Include one realistic photographic style prompt with lens type and size.
Separate different prompts with two new lines.

J’ai créé ce code VBA sur Microsoft excel 2021 version francaise pour me créer un outil de filtre dynamique. L’idée étant que je puisse filtre une base de données dynamiquement (filtre au fur et à mesure de la saisie). Voici donc le script que j’utilise pour le UserForm que j’ai créé :
Code du module:
Public Sub AfficherBoiteDeRecherche()
    ' Appeler le formulaire
    RechercheForm.Show
End Sub

Code pour le UserForm :
Private Sub UserForm_Initialize()
' Remplir ComboBoxTableau
Dim ws As Worksheet
Set ws = ThisWorkbook.ActiveSheet ' Prendre en compte la feuille active uniquement
Dim lo As ListObject
For Each lo In ws.ListObjects
    Me.ComboBoxTableau.AddItem lo.Name ' Changer pour ajouter le nom des tableaux
Next lo
Me.ComboBoxTableau.ListIndex = 0 ' Sélectionner automatiquement le premier tableau
End Sub

Private Sub ComboBoxTableau_Change()
' Remplir ComboBoxColonne
If Me.ComboBoxTableau.ListIndex > -1 Then
    Dim tblName As String
    tblName = Me.ComboBoxTableau.Text
    Dim ws As Worksheet
    Set ws = ThisWorkbook.ActiveSheet ' Prendre en compte la feuille active uniquement
    Dim lo As ListObject
    Set lo = ws.ListObjects(tblName)
    Me.ComboBoxColonne.Clear
    Dim col As ListColumn
    For Each col In lo.ListColumns
        Me.ComboBoxColonne.AddItem col.Name
    Next col
End If
End Sub

Private Function IsNumberColumn(rng As Range) As Boolean
Dim cell As Range
For Each cell In rng
    If Not IsEmpty(cell) Then
        If IsNumeric(cell.Value) Then
            IsNumberColumn = True
        Else
            IsNumberColumn = False
        End If
        Exit For
    End If
Next cell
End Function

Private Sub TextBoxRecherche_Change()
' Filtrer en fonction de la recherche
If Me.ComboBoxTableau.ListIndex > -1 And Me.ComboBoxColonne.ListIndex > -1 Then
    Dim tblName As String
    tblName = Me.ComboBoxTableau.Text
    Dim colName As String
    colName = Me.ComboBoxColonne.Text
    Dim ws As Worksheet
    Set ws = ThisWorkbook.ActiveSheet ' Prendre en compte la feuille active uniquement
    Dim lo As ListObject
    Set lo = ws.ListObjects(tblName)
    Dim colRange As Range
    Set colRange = lo.ListColumns(colName).DataBodyRange
    
    If Me.TextBoxRecherche.Text <> "" Then
        If IsNumberColumn(colRange) Then
            lo.Range.AutoFilter Field:=lo.ListColumns(colName).Index, Criteria1:="=" & Me.TextBoxRecherche.Text
        Else
            lo.Range.AutoFilter Field:=lo.ListColumns(colName).Index, Criteria1:="=*" & Me.TextBoxRecherche.Text & "*"
        End If
        DoEvents ' Forcer la mise à jour d'Excel
        Application.ScreenUpdating = True
    Else
        lo.AutoFilter.ShowAllData
    End If
End If
End Sub
Private Sub TextBoxRecherche_MouseDown(ByVal Button As Integer, ByVal Shift As Integer, ByVal X As Single, ByVal Y As Single)
    ' Sélectionner tout le texte dans TextBoxRecherche lorsque l'utilisateur clique dessus
    Me.TextBoxRecherche.SelStart = 0
    Me.TextBoxRecherche.SelLength = Len(Me.TextBoxRecherche.Text)
End Sub

import pygame
import random
import pytweening

def Tween(value, endValue, step):
    result = []
    for i in range(step+1):
        t = i / step
        interpolated_value = pytweening.easeOutSine(t) * (endValue - value) + value
        result.append(interpolated_value)
    return result

# Aantal Spelers

    global spelers, posities
    spelers = aantal
    
    posities = [0] * spelers

setPlayers(spelers)

# Houdt bij wie aan de beurt is (0 = speler1, 1 = speler2, etc)
beurt = 0

# Houdt de dobbelsteenworp bij
worp = 0

# Afmetingen van het venster
screen_width = 1005
screen_height = 953

     25:11,
}

# Functie om aan te geven of er naar een speciaal vakje moet worden gegaan
def handle_special_position(position):
    for x in special_positions:
        index = x
        if position == index:
            value = special_positions[x]
            return True, value
    return False, None

# Laad alle dobbelsteen afbeeldingen
dice_images = {}
for i in range(1, 7):
    dice_images[i] = pygame.image.load(f"dice\dice{i}.png")

# Functie om een dobbelsteen van een bepaald nummer te laten zien op een plek op het scherm
def RollDiceAtPosition(x, y, number):
    # Selecteer de juiste dobbelsteen afbeelding
    dice_image = dice_images[number]
    
    # Laat de dobbelsteen foto zien
    dice_rect = dice_image.get_rect(center=(x, y))
    screen.blit(dice_image, dice_rect)
    pygame.display.flip()
    pygame.time.delay(100)


# Oneindige loop totdat het kruisje wordt geklikt om het af te sluiten
done = False
# Klok voor de framerate
clock = pygame.time.Clock()


# define colors
WHITE = (255, 255, 255)
BLACK = (0, 0, 0)
BLUE = (0, 0, 255)
GREEN = (0, 255, 0)

# define fonts
font = pygame.font.SysFont(None, 32)

# define button class
class Button:
    def __init__(self, rect, text, text_color, bg_color, font):
        self.rect = pygame.Rect(rect)
        self.text = text
        self.text_color = text_color
        self.bg_color = bg_color
        self.font = font
        self.rendered_text = self.font.render(self.text, True, self.text_color)
        self.rendered_text_rect = self.rendered_text.get_rect(center=self.rect.center)
    
    def draw(self, surface):
        pygame.draw.rect(surface, self.bg_color, self.rect)
        surface.blit(self.rendered_text, self.rendered_text_rect)
    
    def contains_point(self, point):
        return self.rect.collidepoint(point)

# define buttons
button_option_4_players = []
for i in range(4):
    rect = (screen_width/2 - 200 + 100*i, screen_height/2 - 125, 100, 50)
    text = f"{i+1} player{'s' if i != 0 else ''}"
    button = Button(rect, text, WHITE, GREEN, font)
    button_option_4_players.append(button)

play_button = Button((screen_width/2 - 100, screen_height/2 + 25, 200, 50), "Play", WHITE, BLUE, font)
players_label = Button((screen_width/2 - 100, screen_height/2 - 200, 200, 50), "Players", WHITE, BLACK, font)


def toonMenu():
    # set up the loop
    running = True
    while running:
        # handle events
        for event in pygame.event.get():
            if event.type == pygame.QUIT:
                running = False
            elif event.type == pygame.MOUSEBUTTONUP:
                pos = pygame.mouse.get_pos()
                if play_button.contains_point(pos):
                    print("Play button clicked!")
                    running = False
                for button in button_option_4_players:
                    if button.contains_point(pos):
                        setPlayers(int(button.text[0]))
                        for b in button_option_4_players:
                            b.bg_color = GREEN
                        button.bg_color = BLUE

        # draw the screen
        screen.fill(BLACK)
        for button in button_option_4_players:
            button.draw(screen)
        play_button.draw(screen)
        players_label.draw(screen)

        # update the screen
        pygame.display.flip()

        # tick the clock
        clock.tick(60)

toonMenu()



def update_screen():
        # ---------- Teken de graphics (nog buiten beeld) ----------

    screen.fill((255,255,255)) # Begint met een witte achtergrond

    bordrect = bord_afbeelding.get_rect() # Vraag afmetingen (rectange) van het bordplaatje op
    screen.blit(bord_afbeelding, bordrect) # Teken het bord


    # Teken pionnen als gekleurde cirkels op de coordinaten van de vakjes waar ze staan:
    spelerkleuren = [(255, 0, 0), (0, 0, 255), (0, 255, 0), (0, 0, 0)] #Rood, Blauw, Groen, Zwart 

    for x in range(spelers):
        spelerx = vakjes[posities[x]][0] + x*3
        spelery = vakjes[posities[x]][1] + x*3
        spelerkleur = spelerkleuren[x]
        pygame.draw.circle(screen, spelerkleur, (spelerx, spelery), 10)

    # Kies lettergrootte
    myfont = pygame.font.SysFont(None, 25)

    # Teken laatste worp op het scherm
    text = "Laatste worp: " + str(worp)
    label = myfont.render(text, 1, (204, 0, 0))
    screen.blit(label, (750, 730))

    # Teken de speler die aan de beurt is op het scherm
    text = "Aan de beurt: " + str(beurt + 1)
    label = myfont.render(text, 1, (255, 153, 0))
    screen.blit(label, (750, 700))
    
    # ---------- Ververs het beeldscherm met de nieuwe graphics ----------

    clock.tick(60) # Limiet op 60 Frames per seconde
    pygame.display.flip() # Ververs het beeldscherm met de bijgewerkte versie




# ---------- Hoofdloop van het programma ----------
while not done:
    # ---------- Check gebeurtenissen (zoals muiskliks etc) ----------
    
    for event in pygame.event.get():
        if event.type == pygame.QUIT: # Het kruisje is aangeklikt
            done = True # Het spel moet eindigen dus we zetten done op True
        elif event.type == pygame.KEYDOWN:
            # er is een toets ingedrukt, we kijken welke en ondernemen actie
            if event.key == pygame.K_SPACE:
                # De spatie knop is ingedrukt. We willen nu de dobbelsteen gooien en de pion bewegen

                worp = random.randint(1,6) # De dobbelsteen worp (1-6)
                RollDiceAtPosition(800, 800, worp)

                Tween(posities[beurt], posities[beurt] + worp, 10)
                
                posities[beurt] += worp # Verzet de pion

                # Als de speler op een speciale positie aankomt dan word hij aan het einde van die ladder of slang gezet
                isSpecial, endPosition = handle_special_position(posities[beurt])
                if isSpecial:
                    update_screen()
                    # time.sleep(1)
                    #instead of using the time.sleep above and then teleporting the pawn, we want to instead make it tween
                    
                    posities[beurt] = endPosition

                # Als de speler over het laatste vakje heen gaat dan zal de speler naar het laatste vakje gaan
                if posities[beurt] > 63:
                    verschil = posities[beurt]-63
                    posities[beurt] = 63-verschil
                if posities[beurt] == 63: # Als iemand heeft gewonnen dan
                    toonMenu()
                    # Zet de spelers weer op het beginvakje
                    for x in range(0,spelers,1):
                        posities[x] = 0
                        
                    # Geef de beurt weer aan speler 1
                    beurt = 0
                
                else:
                    # Geef de beurt door aan de volgende speler
                    if beurt < (spelers-1): #spelers is min 1 gedaan omdat de beurt begint op 0
                        beurt += 1
                    else:
                        beurt = 0
    update_screen()


# ---------- Afsluiting ----------
pygame.quit()

In the following Story, find all names and named entities and display them as a list with descriptions for each item.

1: The Carpet Conjuration

Philip rifled through the ancient leather-bound books that lined the towering shelves of Concordia’s vast library, scanning their spines for clues to the obscure art of enchantments he so desperately craved to learn. The flickering candlelight cast long shadows across the musty aisles, a testament to the late hour; the library had the quiet hush of a tomb, disturbed only by the distant echoes of his own footsteps on the worn stone floor.

He noticed a girl sitting nearby, her raven black hair cascading down her shoulders, her piercing purple eyes marking her as a descendant of a particularly powerful line of witchcraft. She was absorbed in her studies, but as Philip leaned closer to sneak a peek at her notes, she looked up at him with a disarming smile that sent his heart racing. Her name was Hailey, and she was a prodigy in the rare field of carpet conjurations.

“I could use some company,” she said, her voice a mellifluous whisper that sent shivers down Philip’s spine. They began discussing their shared interest in enchantments, an animated conversation that lasted hours, time seeming to fly by as they took turns casting minor spells on objects around them, giggling at their beginner’s attempts.

It was well past midnight when Hailey dared to attempt a new, more powerful spell. She told Philip of her dream of conjuring a sentient carpet, a woven servant that would obey her every thought with nary a spoken word. With her magical tome opened before her, she drew a deep breath and began to murmur an incantation, her whispered words seeming to ripple through the air like a pebble thrown into a still pond.

The carpet laid out before her shuddered and twitched, the intricate patterns swirling as the material writhed and wriggled, seemingly taking on a life of its own. Hailey’s eyes widened in a mixture of awe and terror as the threads stretched, trying to form the shape of a face, the outline of a hand, before snapping back into place like an overstressed rubber band.

When Philip brushed against her, his own curiosity urging him closer, Hailey’s concentration broke and the magic quickly spiraled out of control. In an instant, the carpet leapt to life, enveloping Philip like a cocoon, a muffled scream escaping him before it absorbed his essence, the soft material sucking up his soul like a ravenous sponge.

It was at that moment that Hailey discovered her darker desires. She couldn’t pull her gaze away from where only moments before her newfound friend had been standing. The carpet now pulsed with his life force, an eerie golden glow emanating from the once dull fabric.

Uncontrollable urges coursed through her veins as she cast one final spell, causing her heels to emit an enchanted energy. Feeling drunk on the unfamiliar sensation, she stepped onto the sentient carpet. Hailey felt a twisted sense of pleasure as she walked across the rug, each stomp eliciting a faint, agonizing cry from Philip’s trapped consciousness. She felt powerful and invincible.

She took immense satisfaction in crushing the very essence of Philip beneath her enchanted heels, each step imprinting a crater onto his soul. Her heartbeat quickened at the sensation of his pain and she couldn’t help but smirk. Then, as if breaking through a trance, she realized the potential harm she was causing him.

Reality came crashing down around her like a tidal wave; the enormity of the situation nearly buckling her knees. She tore herself away from the enchantment and was consumed by guilt, horrified at the twisted desires that had risen to the surface. She had to save him.

Frantically searching through her mystical tomes for a way to undo the carpet conjuration, Hailey vowed to herself that she would do everything in her power to free Philip from the enchanted prison she had so cruelly trapped him in. The dark halls of Concordia’s library cracked and groaned around her, echoing the torment raging inside her heart.
It was a race against time as Hailey scoured the tomes and scrolls, the life essence of Philip slowly ebbing away with every agonizing step she had taken. She spent days and nights pouring over ancient texts, fighting back the twisted desires that continued to whisper to her from deep inside.

At last, she discovered a reference to a powerful disenchantment ritual that, if performed correctly, could reverse the magic that had trapped Philip’s soul within the carpet. The incantation would be risky and require an immense amount of power, but Hailey was determined to save her friend, no matter the cost.

The night of the anticipated ritual, Hailey gathered the necessary components, including a rare gemstone whose inner light matched the eerie glow of the enchanted carpet. With her magical tools assembled, she lit a circle of black candles and began the arduous process of releasing Philip from his torment, her bold voice resonating through the Concordia library.

As the ritual reached its zenith, Hailey felt the energy of the universe flood into her, a power so great it threatened to overwhelm her senses. Her heart strained beneath the weight of the force as she chanted the final, desperate words of the incantation, channeling every ounce of her strength and determination into undoing the enchantment that had bound Philip to his suffocating prison.

Suddenly, the candles flickered and snuffed out, plunging the library into silence and darkness. For a moment, Hailey could only hear her heart pounding in her chest like the tolling of a bell. And then, from within the void, she heard the first muffled groans of her friend as he clawed his way back into existence.

Philip’s essence slowly separated from the carpet, unwinding itself like a cocoon, returning to its human form with each gasping breath. His eyes fluttered open, fixated on Hailey’s tear-streaked face. He was free.

In the aftermath, the guilt still gnawed at Hailey, but through her unimaginable struggle, she had found redemption. Her ability to overcome her dark desires and rescue her friend had given her the courage to admit her own worth and inner strength.

Philip, taking her frail hand in his, forgave her with a sincerity that urged her to forgive herself. They formed a pact within that ancient library, surrounded by shadows and echoes of their shared ordeal, vowing to remain vigilant against the darkness of their own hearts and enkindle the light within each other.

Together, they continued their study of enchantments at Concordia, knowing that the bond forged between them in the crucible of fear and agony was something powerful, eternal, and unbreakable. United in their passion for magic and driven by a newfound appreciation for life, their destiny was intertwined as they embarked on adventures that would test the very limits of their being and shape the course of their lives forevermore.

Code pour le UserForm :
Private Sub UserForm_Initialize()
’ Remplir ComboBoxTableau
Dim ws As Worksheet
Set ws = ThisWorkbook.ActiveSheet ’ Prendre en compte la feuille active uniquement
Dim lo As ListObject
For Each lo In ws.ListObjects
Me.ComboBoxTableau.AddItem lo.Name ’ Changer pour ajouter le nom des tableaux
Next lo
Me.ComboBoxTableau.ListIndex = 0 ’ Sélectionner automatiquement le premier tableau
End Sub

Private Sub ComboBoxTableau_Change()
’ Remplir ComboBoxColonne
If Me.ComboBoxTableau.ListIndex > -1 Then
Dim tblName As String
tblName = Me.ComboBoxTableau.Text
Dim ws As Worksheet
Set ws = ThisWorkbook.ActiveSheet ’ Prendre en compte la feuille active uniquement
Dim lo As ListObject
Set lo = ws.ListObjects(tblName)
Me.ComboBoxColonne.Clear
Dim col As ListColumn
For Each col In lo.ListColumns
Me.ComboBoxColonne.AddItem col.Name
Next col
End If
End Sub

Private Function IsNumberColumn(rng As Range) As Boolean
Dim cell As Range
For Each cell In rng
If Not IsEmpty(cell) Then
If IsNumeric(cell.Value) Then
IsNumberColumn = True
Else
IsNumberColumn = False
End If
Exit For
End If
Next cell
End Function

Private Sub TextBoxRecherche_Change()
’ Filtrer en fonction de la recherche
If Me.ComboBoxTableau.ListIndex > -1 And Me.ComboBoxColonne.ListIndex > -1 Then
Dim tblName As String
tblName = Me.ComboBoxTableau.Text
Dim colName As String
colName = Me.ComboBoxColonne.Text
Dim ws As Worksheet
Set ws = ThisWorkbook.ActiveSheet ’ Prendre en compte la feuille active uniquement
Dim lo As ListObject
Set lo = ws.ListObjects(tblName)
Dim colRange As Range
Set colRange = lo.ListColumns(colName).DataBodyRange

If Me.TextBoxRecherche.Text <> “” Then
If IsNumberColumn(colRange) Then
lo.Range.AutoFilter Field:=lo.ListColumns(colName).Index, Criteria1:=“=” & Me.TextBoxRecherche.Text
Else
lo.Range.AutoFilter Field:=lo.ListColumns(colName).Index, Criteria1:=“=*" & Me.TextBoxRecherche.Text & "*"
End If
DoEvents ’ Forcer la mise à jour d’Excel
Application.ScreenUpdating = True
Else
lo.AutoFilter.ShowAllData
End If
End If
End Sub
Private Sub TextBoxRecherche_MouseDown(ByVal Button As Integer, ByVal Shift As Integer, ByVal X As Single, ByVal Y As Single)
’ Sélectionner tout le texte dans TextBoxRecherche lorsque l’utilisateur clique dessus
Me.TextBoxRecherche.SelStart = 0
Me.TextBoxRecherche.SelLength = Len(Me.TextBoxRecherche.Text)
End Sub

In the following Story, find all names and named entities and display them as a list with descriptions for each item.

1: The Carpet Conjuration

Philip rifled through the ancient leather-bound books that lined the towering shelves of Concordia’s vast library, scanning their spines for clues to the obscure art of enchantments he so desperately craved to learn. The flickering candlelight cast long shadows across the musty aisles, a testament to the late hour; the library had the quiet hush of a tomb, disturbed only by the distant echoes of his own footsteps on the worn stone floor.

He noticed a girl sitting nearby, her raven black hair cascading down her shoulders, her piercing purple eyes marking her as a descendant of a particularly powerful line of witchcraft. She was absorbed in her studies, but as Philip leaned closer to sneak a peek at her notes, she looked up at him with a disarming smile that sent his heart racing. Her name was Hailey, and she was a prodigy in the rare field of carpet conjurations.

“I could use some company,” she said, her voice a mellifluous whisper that sent shivers down Philip’s spine. They began discussing their shared interest in enchantments, an animated conversation that lasted hours, time seeming to fly by as they took turns casting minor spells on objects around them, giggling at their beginner’s attempts.

It was well past midnight when Hailey dared to attempt a new, more powerful spell. She told Philip of her dream of conjuring a sentient carpet, a woven servant that would obey her every thought with nary a spoken word. With her magical tome opened before her, she drew a deep breath and began to murmur an incantation, her whispered words seeming to ripple through the air like a pebble thrown into a still pond.

The carpet laid out before her shuddered and twitched, the intricate patterns swirling as the material writhed and wriggled, seemingly taking on a life of its own. Hailey’s eyes widened in a mixture of awe and terror as the threads stretched, trying to form the shape of a face, the outline of a hand, before snapping back into place like an overstressed rubber band.

When Philip brushed against her, his own curiosity urging him closer, Hailey’s concentration broke and the magic quickly spiraled out of control. In an instant, the carpet leapt to life, enveloping Philip like a cocoon, a muffled scream escaping him before it absorbed his essence, the soft material sucking up his soul like a ravenous sponge.

It was at that moment that Hailey discovered her darker desires. She couldn’t pull her gaze away from where only moments before her newfound friend had been standing. The carpet now pulsed with his life force, an eerie golden glow emanating from the once dull fabric.

Uncontrollable urges coursed through her veins as she cast one final spell, causing her heels to emit an enchanted energy. Feeling drunk on the unfamiliar sensation, she stepped onto the sentient carpet. Hailey felt a twisted sense of pleasure as she walked across the rug, each stomp eliciting a faint, agonizing cry from Philip’s trapped consciousness. She felt powerful and invincible.

She took immense satisfaction in crushing the very essence of Philip beneath her enchanted heels, each step imprinting a crater onto his soul. Her heartbeat quickened at the sensation of his pain and she couldn’t help but smirk. Then, as if breaking through a trance, she realized the potential harm she was causing him.

Reality came crashing down around her like a tidal wave; the enormity of the situation nearly buckling her knees. She tore herself away from the enchantment and was consumed by guilt, horrified at the twisted desires that had risen to the surface. She had to save him.

Frantically searching through her mystical tomes for a way to undo the carpet conjuration, Hailey vowed to herself that she would do everything in her power to free Philip from the enchanted prison she had so cruelly trapped him in. The dark halls of Concordia’s library cracked and groaned around her, echoing the torment raging inside her heart.
It was a race against time as Hailey scoured the tomes and scrolls, the life essence of Philip slowly ebbing away with every agonizing step she had taken. She spent days and nights pouring over ancient texts, fighting back the twisted desires that continued to whisper to her from deep inside.

At last, she discovered a reference to a powerful disenchantment ritual that, if performed correctly, could reverse the magic that had trapped Philip’s soul within the carpet. The incantation would be risky and require an immense amount of power, but Hailey was determined to save her friend, no matter the cost.

The night of the anticipated ritual, Hailey gathered the necessary components, including a rare gemstone whose inner light matched the eerie glow of the enchanted carpet. With her magical tools assembled, she lit a circle of black candles and began the arduous process of releasing Philip from his torment, her bold voice resonating through the Concordia library.

As the ritual reached its zenith, Hailey felt the energy of the universe flood into her, a power so great it threatened to overwhelm her senses. Her heart strained beneath the weight of the force as she chanted the final, desperate words of the incantation, channeling every ounce of her strength and determination into undoing the enchantment that had bound Philip to his suffocating prison.

Suddenly, the candles flickered and snuffed out, plunging the library into silence and darkness. For a moment, Hailey could only hear her heart pounding in her chest like the tolling of a bell. And then, from within the void, she heard the first muffled groans of her friend as he clawed his way back into existence.

Philip’s essence slowly separated from the carpet, unwinding itself like a cocoon, returning to its human form with each gasping breath. His eyes fluttered open, fixated on Hailey’s tear-streaked face. He was free.

In the aftermath, the guilt still gnawed at Hailey, but through her unimaginable struggle, she had found redemption. Her ability to overcome her dark desires and rescue her friend had given her the courage to admit her own worth and inner strength.

Philip, taking her frail hand in his, forgave her with a sincerity that urged her to forgive herself. They formed a pact within that ancient library, surrounded by shadows and echoes of their shared ordeal, vowing to remain vigilant against the darkness of their own hearts and enkindle the light within each other.

Together, they continued their study of enchantments at Concordia, knowing that the bond forged between them in the crucible of fear and agony was something powerful, eternal, and unbreakable. United in their passion for magic and driven by a newfound appreciation for life, their destiny was intertwined as they embarked on adventures that would test the very limits of their being and shape the course of their lives forevermore.

一、租赁物基本情况及用途
1.1租赁物位于大连市甘井子区华北路307-1（保险汽车修配厂院内），建筑面积约1300㎡，场地面积约1300㎡（该面积不含与原房东以及旁边租户的公共区域面积）。
1.2 租赁物为甲方在原出租方（                ）场地上自行建设的建筑，在租赁期内具有完全使用权，有权对外出租。该房租赁物的产权、权证情况在本合同签署之前甲方已经明确告知乙方，及相关合同和权证作为本合同附件。
如因原出租方阻止转租或因其他非乙方原因导致乙方租赁期间房屋租赁权和使用权受阻，甲方免除乙方受阻期间的租金。如乙方经营受阻超过30日的，乙方有权解除合同，甲方应赔偿乙方折旧后的装修费用及搬场费用，退还乙方剩余租金和押金。
1.3乙方使用租赁物经营汽车销售及售后服务。
二、租赁期限及续租
2.1首次租期为【五】年，自【2023】年【06】月【01】日起至【2028】年【05】月【31】日止（含首尾两日），自本和同签订生效后7日内乙方向甲方支付首年房租，房租支付七日内甲方向乙交付房屋，房屋交付日至2023年6月1日前为该房屋免租期。因乙方付款延迟导致免租期减少，则不影响房租原有租期。
2.2合同到期后在同等条件下乙方有优先承租权。除非乙方未在本合同租期届满前60日内向甲方发出书面通知表达不再续约的诉求，否则乙方在本合同租期届满后将自动续租3年。续租期届满后将沿用前述方式，直至双方达成一致，乙方不再续租。有关本合同续签期或延长期的租金和条款、条件等仍依照本合同约定执行，除非甲方与乙方另有约定。
三、租赁物交付
3.1甲方应于2023年06月01日前向乙方交付符合约定的租赁物，双方同时应签署交接单，以确认租赁物原始情况。
3.2租赁物场所的现有电容为10KW，可扩容，乙方；场地内供热为自有锅炉供暖，在租赁期间，乙方如需要增加水、电的容量乙方可以自行办理，因此产生的费用由乙方承担。本协议期满或是提前解除后，乙方因为增容相应增加的设施、设备无偿归甲方所有。
四、	租赁价格及押金
4.1甲、乙双方同意并确认，该租赁标的物含税租赁价格为：90万元/年（大写：玖拾万元整/年）。租金每3年一递增，递增金额为5万元，即2023年6月1日到2026年5月31日，租金为90万元/年；2026年6月1日到2028年5月31日，租金为95万元/年。
4.2租赁押金为10万元整（大写：拾万元整）。
五、	租金支付方式及时间
5.1租金每一年支付一次。第一次租金在本合同签订后七日内，向甲方支付第一次一年租金90万元。以后租金，均在当年的4月30日前交付（即2024年4月30日前支付第二次租金）。
5.2本合同租金不含税金。
5.3租赁的房屋交付前产生的全部费用由甲方承担，交付后新产生的费用由乙方承担（因甲方违约产生的费用及本协议约定由甲方承担的费用除外）。
5.5甲方收款账户为：
开户行：
银行账号：
甲方应保证上述收款信息真实，若因甲方提供的账户信息有误或甲方变更该收款账户，未提前五个工作日书面通知乙方，由此引起的一切后果由甲方承担，乙方不承担任何违约责任。
六、	房屋、场地、专用设施改造、装修和使用期间对房屋的维护
6.1	甲乙方对该房屋进行改造和装修，装修方案征得甲方同意后，乙方有权对租赁房屋进行改造、扩建和装修，乙方必须保证房租结构安全，装修改造费用由乙方承担，并负责该租赁场所内，由乙方自身改造、扩建和装饰装修之建设工程范围内的以及自行添加设施设备的维护、维修和更换。如遇到原出租方阻挠或干扰乙方的上述施工行为，甲方应负责积极协调解决，并根据停工天数顺延乙方免租天数。
6.2	本合同签订时对于该房屋的现状、乙方无异议。双反已确认场地设施设备交时使用状态完好,但日常维护维应由乙方行。
该租赁场所的所有内外部结构主体修缮以维持该租赁场所的内外部构件（包括房屋主体结构及租赁场所与主干线相连接的公用线路）处于良好状态，并承担所需一切费用。
乙方如改变房屋、场地的结构，或设置对房屋结构有影响的设备，其设计规模、范围、工艺、用料等方案均须事先征得甲方的同意后方可施工（图纸等材料备案留存）。同时在租赁期内，乙方保证在装修等过程中的行为必须符合有关法律、法规及规章制度的规定，。因乙方若乙方对该房屋作出的装修、改动、加建或拆除因违反政府法规、被政府有关部门要

make the following letter 400 words long: Tere!

Mu nimi on Kelli Pala ja ma kandideerin võimaluseks töötada Põlva Sõbralt Sõbrale poes. Mul ei ole varasemat töökogemust, kuid ma olen valmis uusi väljakutseid vastu võtma ning end tõestama.

Olen alati olnud huvitatud ideest, millel on positiivne mõju meie planeedile. Seetõttu soovin väga kandideerida võimaluse nimel töötada Sõbralt Sõbrale taaskasutuspoes. Olen alati austanud organisatsiooni missiooni aidata luua positiivset mõju keskkonnale ja usun, et saan kasutada oma oskusi ning panustada selle eesmärgi saavutamisse.

Hoian ennast pidevalt kursis keskkonnasäästu ja jätkusuutlikkuse arengutega, ning on minu siiras soov olla saavutuste otseses kaasosaline. Usun, et töö taaskasutuspoes on suurepärane võimalus aidata kaasa ühiskonna ja looduse jätkusuutlikule arengule. Tööd tehes seaksin endale eesmärgi anda endast parim, et pakkuda klientidele põhjalikku teenindust ning samal ajal teadvustada nende endi võimalusi keskkonnale positiivset mõju avaldada.

Minu loovus ja suur kujutlusvõime on samuti tugevuseks. Mul on ka loomulikult sõbralik iseloom, mis aitab luua positiivset suhtlemist klientidega. Olen ka väga kiire õppija, suudan kiiresti kohaneda uute olukordadega ja omandada teadmisi, mis on töökohal vajalikud.

Mul on hea meel öelda, et olen alati olnud huvitatud taaskasutamisest ja armastan parandada asju, mis on katki läinud. Seetõttu arvan, et see on suurepärane eelis, kui töötan Sõbralt Sõbrale poes. Kogu oma südamest usun, et töötamine taaskasutuskaupluses on boonuseks minu elulisele kutsumusele ja elu meeldivaim osa.

Kui saan võimaluse teie poes töötada, luban, et panustan maksimaalselt, et teie kliendid saaksid parimat teenindust. Samuti panustan poe ja selle laoruumide korrashoiule.

Tänan teid väga, et võimaldasite mul kandideerida sellele põnevale võimalusele ning olen lootusrikas, et saan teiega ühineda.

Kelli Pala

Based on the following example, come up with a detailed description of Concordia.

1: The Carpet Conjuration

Philip rifled through the ancient leather-bound books that lined the towering shelves of Concordia’s vast library, scanning their spines for clues to the obscure art of enchantments he so desperately craved to learn. The flickering candlelight cast long shadows across the musty aisles, a testament to the late hour; the library had the quiet hush of a tomb, disturbed only by the distant echoes of his own footsteps on the worn stone floor.

He noticed a girl sitting nearby, her raven black hair cascading down her shoulders, her piercing purple eyes marking her as a descendant of a particularly powerful line of witchcraft. She was absorbed in her studies, but as Philip leaned closer to sneak a peek at her notes, she looked up at him with a disarming smile that sent his heart racing. Her name was Hailey, and she was a prodigy in the rare field of carpet conjurations.

“I could use some company,” she said, her voice a mellifluous whisper that sent shivers down Philip’s spine. They began discussing their shared interest in enchantments, an animated conversation that lasted hours, time seeming to fly by as they took turns casting minor spells on objects around them, giggling at their beginner’s attempts.

It was well past midnight when Hailey dared to attempt a new, more powerful spell. She told Philip of her dream of conjuring a sentient carpet, a woven servant that would obey her every thought with nary a spoken word. With her magical tome opened before her, she drew a deep breath and began to murmur an incantation, her whispered words seeming to ripple through the air like a pebble thrown into a still pond.

The carpet laid out before her shuddered and twitched, the intricate patterns swirling as the material writhed and wriggled, seemingly taking on a life of its own. Hailey’s eyes widened in a mixture of awe and terror as the threads stretched, trying to form the shape of a face, the outline of a hand, before snapping back into place like an overstressed rubber band.

When Philip brushed against her, his own curiosity urging him closer, Hailey’s concentration broke and the magic quickly spiraled out of control. In an instant, the carpet leapt to life, enveloping Philip like a cocoon, a muffled scream escaping him before it absorbed his essence, the soft material sucking up his soul like a ravenous sponge.

It was at that moment that Hailey discovered her darker desires. She couldn’t pull her gaze away from where only moments before her newfound friend had been standing. The carpet now pulsed with his life force, an eerie golden glow emanating from the once dull fabric.

Uncontrollable urges coursed through her veins as she cast one final spell, causing her heels to emit an enchanted energy. Feeling drunk on the unfamiliar sensation, she stepped onto the sentient carpet. Hailey felt a twisted sense of pleasure as she walked across the rug, each stomp eliciting a faint, agonizing cry from Philip’s trapped consciousness. She felt powerful and invincible.

She took immense satisfaction in crushing the very essence of Philip beneath her enchanted heels, each step imprinting a crater onto his soul. Her heartbeat quickened at the sensation of his pain and she couldn’t help but smirk. Then, as if breaking through a trance, she realized the potential harm she was causing him.

Reality came crashing down around her like a tidal wave; the enormity of the situation nearly buckling her knees. She tore herself away from the enchantment and was consumed by guilt, horrified at the twisted desires that had risen to the surface. She had to save him.

Frantically searching through her mystical tomes for a way to undo the carpet conjuration, Hailey vowed to herself that she would do everything in her power to free Philip from the enchanted prison she had so cruelly trapped him in. The dark halls of Concordia’s library cracked and groaned around her, echoing the torment raging inside her heart.
It was a race against time as Hailey scoured the tomes and scrolls, the life essence of Philip slowly ebbing away with every agonizing step she had taken. She spent days and nights pouring over ancient texts, fighting back the twisted desires that continued to whisper to her from deep inside.

At last, she discovered a reference to a powerful disenchantment ritual that, if performed correctly, could reverse the magic that had trapped Philip’s soul within the carpet. The incantation would be risky and require an immense amount of power, but Hailey was determined to save her friend, no matter the cost.

The night of the anticipated ritual, Hailey gathered the necessary components, including a rare gemstone whose inner light matched the eerie glow of the enchanted carpet. With her magical tools assembled, she lit a circle of black candles and began the arduous process of releasing Philip from his torment, her bold voice resonating through the Concordia library.

As the ritual reached its zenith, Hailey felt the energy of the universe flood into her, a power so great it threatened to overwhelm her senses. Her heart strained beneath the weight of the force as she chanted the final, desperate words of the incantation, channeling every ounce of her strength and determination into undoing the enchantment that had bound Philip to his suffocating prison.

Suddenly, the candles flickered and snuffed out, plunging the library into silence and darkness. For a moment, Hailey could only hear her heart pounding in her chest like the tolling of a bell. And then, from within the void, she heard the first muffled groans of her friend as he clawed his way back into existence.

Philip’s essence slowly separated from the carpet, unwinding itself like a cocoon, returning to its human form with each gasping breath. His eyes fluttered open, fixated on Hailey’s tear-streaked face. He was free.

In the aftermath, the guilt still gnawed at Hailey, but through her unimaginable struggle, she had found redemption. Her ability to overcome her dark desires and rescue her friend had given her the courage to admit her own worth and inner strength.

Philip, taking her frail hand in his, forgave her with a sincerity that urged her to forgive herself. They formed a pact within that ancient library, surrounded by shadows and echoes of their shared ordeal, vowing to remain vigilant against the darkness of their own hearts and enkindle the light within each other.

Together, they continued their study of enchantments at Concordia, knowing that the bond forged between them in the crucible of fear and agony was something powerful, eternal, and unbreakable. United in their passion for magic and driven by a newfound appreciation for life, their destiny was intertwined as they embarked on adventures that would test the very limits of their being and shape the course of their lives forevermore.

J’ai créé ce code VBA sur Microsoft excel 2021 version francaise pour me créer un outil de filtre dynamique. L’idée étant que je puisse filtre une base de données dynamiquement (filtre au fur et à mesure de la saisie). Voici donc le script que j’utilise pour le UserForm que j’ai créé :
Code du module:
Public Sub AfficherBoiteDeRecherche()
' Appeler le formulaire
RechercheForm.Show
End Sub

Code pour le UserForm :
Private Sub UserForm_Initialize()
' Remplir ComboBoxTableau
Dim ws As Worksheet
Set ws = ThisWorkbook.ActiveSheet ' Prendre en compte la feuille active uniquement
Dim lo As ListObject
For Each lo In ws.ListObjects
Me.ComboBoxTableau.AddItem lo.Name ' Changer pour ajouter le nom des tableaux
Next lo
Me.ComboBoxTableau.ListIndex = 0 ' Sélectionner automatiquement le premier tableau
End Sub

Private Sub ComboBoxTableau_Change()
' Remplir ComboBoxColonne
If Me.ComboBoxTableau.ListIndex > -1 Then
Dim tblName As String
tblName = Me.ComboBoxTableau.Text
Dim ws As Worksheet
Set ws = ThisWorkbook.ActiveSheet ' Prendre en compte la feuille active uniquement
Dim lo As ListObject
Set lo = ws.ListObjects(tblName)
Me.ComboBoxColonne.Clear
Dim col As ListColumn
For Each col In lo.ListColumns
Me.ComboBoxColonne.AddItem col.Name
Next col
End If
End Sub

Private Function IsNumberColumn(rng As Range) As Boolean
Dim cell As Range
For Each cell In rng
If Not IsEmpty(cell) Then
If IsNumeric(cell.Value) Then
IsNumberColumn = True
Else
IsNumberColumn = False
End If
Exit For
End If
Next cell
End Function

Private Sub TextBoxRecherche_Change()
' Filtrer en fonction de la recherche
If Me.ComboBoxTableau.ListIndex > -1 And Me.ComboBoxColonne.ListIndex > -1 Then
Dim tblName As String
tblName = Me.ComboBoxTableau.Text
Dim colName As String
colName = Me.ComboBoxColonne.Text
Dim ws As Worksheet
Set ws = ThisWorkbook.ActiveSheet ' Prendre en compte la feuille active uniquement
Dim lo As ListObject
Set lo = ws.ListObjects(tblName)
Dim colRange As Range
Set colRange = lo.ListColumns(colName).DataBodyRange

If Me.TextBoxRecherche.Text <> "" Then
    If IsNumberColumn(colRange) Then
        lo.Range.AutoFilter Field:=lo.ListColumns(colName).Index, Criteria1:="=" & Me.TextBoxRecherche.Text
    Else
        lo.Range.AutoFilter Field:=lo.ListColumns(colName).Index, Criteria1:="=*" & Me.TextBoxRecherche.Text & "*"
    End If
    DoEvents ' Forcer la mise à jour d'Excel
    Application.ScreenUpdating = True
Else
    lo.AutoFilter.ShowAllData
End If
End If
End Sub
Private Sub TextBoxRecherche_MouseDown(ByVal Button As Integer, ByVal Shift As Integer, ByVal X As Single, ByVal Y As Single)
' Sélectionner tout le texte dans TextBoxRecherche lorsque l'utilisateur clique dessus
Me.TextBoxRecherche.SelStart = 0
Me.TextBoxRecherche.SelLength = Len(Me.TextBoxRecherche.Text)
End Sub

def scrape_text(url):
    response = requests.get(url)

    if response.status_code >= 400:
        return "Error: HTTP " + str(response.status_code) + " error"

    soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, "html.parser")

    for script in soup(["script", "style"]):
        script.extract()

    text = soup.get_text()
    lines = (line.strip() for line in text.splitlines())
    chunks = (phrase.strip() for line in lines for phrase in line.split("  "))
    text = '\n'.join(chunk for chunk in chunks if chunk)

    return text

		clean_result = {"title": result.get("title", ""), "snippet": result.get("snippet", ""), "link": result.get("link", "")}
		if "date" in result:
			clean_result["date"] = result["date"]
		clean_response["results"].append(clean_result)
	if "knowledge_graph" in results and "description" in results["knowledge_graph"]:
		clean_response["direct_answer"] = results["knowledge_graph"]["description"]

	return clean_response
